intro: Dalechampia capensis, commonly known as the Cape dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers full sun and moderate watering.
